p: Some EOs have already been investigated in animal nutrition studies [ 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16]. Plants from the Lamiaceae family are particularly promising [ 15, 16, 17, 18, 19]; for example, Denli et al. [ 20] added thyme essential oil to the diet of quail, resulting in significantly increased body weight gain and better feed efficiency relative to a control group. A member of the Lamiaceae, Monarda didyma L., has been used for millennia by indigenous people in North America to treat colic, flatulence, colds, and flu. This plant is also used in infusions for intestinal and stomach problems [ 21], and is particularly useful for treating digestive disorders [ 22].
